fields.description:
If a user signs up with an invalid e-mail address, and submits a new issue, then the "assigned to" user recieves an infinite set of e-mail notifications. 

This appears to be because the mail is first sent to the "assigned to", and then sent to the user who reported the bug. If the second send fails (when sending to the invalid user e-mail address), the mail is left in the mail queue, and then resent every minute.

Stack trace is:

javax.mail.SendFailedException: Sending failed;
  nested exception is:
        javax.mail.SendFailedException: Invalid Addresses;
  nested exception is:
        javax.mail.SendFailedException: 550 5.1.2 unknown host or domain: nate@$
        at javax.mail.Transport.send0(Transport.java:219)
        at javax.mail.Transport.send(Transport.java:81)
        at alt.javax.mail.TransportImpl.send(TransportImpl.java:18)
        at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.send(SMTPMailServe$
        at com.atlassian.mail.MailFactory.sendEncodedMail(MailFactory.java:92)
        at com.atlassian.jira.mail.UserMailQueueItem.send(UserMailQueueItem.jav$
        at com.atlassian.jira.mail.MailQueue.sendBuffer(MailQueue.java:60)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailQueueService.run(MailQu$
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainer.run(JiraServiceConta$
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:$
        at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:160)
        at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.$
rethrown as com.atlassian.mail.MailException: Sending failed;
  nested exception is:
        javax.mail.SendFailedException: Invalid Addresses;
  nested exception is:
        javax.mail.SendFailedException: 550 5.1.2 unknown host or domain: nate@$
        at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.send(SMTPMailServe$
        at com.atlassian.mail.MailFactory.sendEncodedMail(MailFactory.java:92)
fields.summary: Infinite e-mail with invalid user e-mail address

fields.description:
There should be at least two base URLs:

- Base URL for external users
- Base URL for internal users

External users may access JIRA through a firewall and the address of JIRA for external access may be different from the address of the internal server.

Another minor thing is that the base URL is not checked if it contains a '/' at the end.
If you enter a base URL like 'http://www.schniebiwutz.com/jira/' JIRA generates emails with 'http://www.schniebiwutz.com/jira//...'.
fields.summary: Create a second base URL

fields.description: For TWIi installation.  Cannot submit bugs.  Please email or call 617-7792495.

fields.description: I had archived some old versions, but then when I edited an old bug (which had been originally reported on that version), it removed the version info. I guess the select list didn't have the archived version anymore, so it couldn't be "selected".  I'd like to archive some old versions since I'm not creating new issues or fixing issues as of those old versions, but I'd rather not lose when a bug was originally spotted.
fields.summary: Archive versions cause loss of version info

fields.description:
There are a number of issues with the current authenticator pluggability API.

For one thing, The soap Authentication service uses DefaultAuthenticator, instead of getting the actually used authenticator

Secondly, the logout page uses keys from DefaultAuthenticator. A more pluggable solution with be a logout callback in the authenticator API.

Ideally DefaultAuthenticator should never be imported/used anywhere, and just specified in a config file.
fields.summary: Custom authenticator not used everywhere

fields.description: We have 8 projects in our system. Our developers and QA would like a way to not only move around the portlets on the dashboard but to manually set the sort order in the "All Projects" portlet. This would allow them to set the project they are working on to be the first one in the list.
fields.summary: Allow users to Sort Projects on Dashboard

fields.description: Allow information displayed on Issue Navigator to be user configurable through Dashboard Configuration.  Available configurable fields to include Custom Fields.
fields.summary: Dashboard Config to allow configuration of Issue Navigator content

fields.description: Move default portlet configuration from DefaultPortletManager to default-portlets.xml.
fields.summary: Move default portlet config to XML file

fields.description: When I click "Manage Attachments" for any issue that has them, the components, affects, and fix for fields always say NONE, even though the issues have these items set correctly.  I don't think this is a caching issue.
fields.summary: Versions fields wrong on manage attachments screen
Assign Multiple Notification Schemes to a Project

fields.description:
The "Login or Signup" link on the right hand side of the dashboard should use the custom colours.

This could be seen at http://jira.opensymphony.com/.
fields.summary: Login screen should use custom colors

fields.description:
We need summary reports over the issues with various criteria.

We need not always to see the filter comment in the dashboard

fields.description: Maybe with Back and Next buttons or links ?
fields.summary: It would be usefull sometimes to be able to scroll issues back and forth

fields.description: It is not always convenient that the person resolving an issue gets automatically assigned. This should be an option.
fields.summary: It is not always convenient that the person resolving an issue gets automatically assigned

fields.description:
It should be possible to better enhance the filters.

Usage case: Issues assigned to NN1 and NN2

Usage case: Issues not matching the version 1.x
fields.summary: Better support for logical operation (and/or/not) type of filters.

fields.description:
We need to be able to update several issues with one batch update.

Usage case: Attach build number to a set of issues
Usage case: Close several (selected) issues with one command
fields.summary: Batch update possibility ?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1558].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; unfortunately we don't have any plans to support this in JIRA for the foreseeable future. There are a [large number of add-ons available in the Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?q=clone] that provide this feature.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

*Original request description*

As JIRA users we want the ability to copy / clone JIRA issues between multiple projects in such a way that all information related to the issue being copied is retained, specifically: summary, description, comments, labels, assignee and reporter, versions and components plus all the content stored in the custom fields.
fields.summary: Deep copy an issue to the same project or a single project
It would be nice to have a possibility to group filters in the dashboard

fields.description:
I've come across a couple of issues in the xdoclet JIRA in the last day or two which although they already had status "Resolved" still gave a Workflow Action to resolve the issue, not the option to close it.  So, since I wanted to close it anyway, I selected this option and hit the "Resolve & Close" button.  Although this successfully closes the issue, in the process it changes the Assignee field to myself which is incorrect (it wasn't me that resolved it, I'm just tidying up afterwards).

I don't know if it's significant, but both the issues that have done this to me so far were previously Resolved as Duplicates.  The most recent one was XDT-383 http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/xdoclet/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=XDT-383
It had status Resolved Duplicate, assigned to xdoclet-devel.  I clicked "Resolve", then "Resolve & Close", and now it's Closed Duplicate assigned to me.  The previous issue that did it was XDT-110.  At the time I'd figured I must have just not noticed changing the Assignee field as I did it, but I looked out for that when I did XDT-383 and there's no editable Assignee field on the screen at the time.

Even asides from the fact that the option to resolve is still offered despite the fact that they are, in my opinion it shouldn't be reassigning it even if I was doing it on a normal open issue.  Developers sometimes forget to close their issues after fixing them.  If I go in and do it after seeing the CVS commit messages, I'd still want them to be listed as the Assignee.  Otherwise I might get the blame if their fix breaks something else :-)

On the other hand, if resolving open issues doesn't normally do that (I haven't found a suitable one to try it out on), then just ignore that last paragraph...
fields.summary: Resolved issues still showing option to resolve; reassigns them when I do so.

fields.description: In a multi-project system, users are often ignoring the project drop-down and move ahead with creating an issue.  Suggest having a "Select a project..." as the default if more than one is available to that user which forces them to select a project before continuing.
fields.summary: Force selection of correct project for Create Issue

fields.description: I created a project and allowed unassigned issues. Later, I decided to revoke that feature. However, all unassigned issues remained unassigned. They should probably have been re-assigned to the project lead.
fields.summary: Unassigned issues not change when project is changed to disallow "unassigned" issues.

fields.description:
Would it be possible to add a priority descending sort order to the "Outstanding" filters for each project?

When I view the outstanding issues, I like to know which should be fixed first.  (I generally always sort this page before using it.)
fields.summary: Add priority sort to "Outstanding" project filter

fields.description:
Hi,

Just noticed you cannot start a query with a '+'.  To replicate just enter +query as a search term on the find issues page.

Cheers,

  Mike
fields.summary: Cannot start query with +
Ability to rename a user

fields.description:
If you select resolved resently you will get a list of issues marked as resolved and closed.

This is presented to you ind view mode: browser.

then if you select printable as view mode. all closed issues is removed from the list, and they don?t come back if switch back to browser view mode.

I tested it in this jira (2.0.2) and the same thing happens.
fields.summary: Inconsistensy between browser and printable view, under resolved resently

fields.description:
Problem:

Our bugzilla system uses shift-jis for encoding japanese strings. The bugzilla import tool assumes ascii (or something else) for the data.

We develop applications in japanese, and the applications display error messages in japanese, all of these have been mangled.

Fix:

Add a field to the Bugzilla Import form that allows the administrator performing the import to set a character set to convert from.

Add code to the bugzilla import class that translates from the specified character set to UTF-8 as the data is imported.
fields.summary: Bugzilla import mangles non-ascii

fields.description: It would be useful if the printed out list of issues from the issue navigator (printable view) had an indication of the time and date that the filter was run.
fields.summary: Show time/date run on printable view

fields.description:
Here's my mini-spec, does it do all you need?
- the CVSLogHandler takes a single handler param (weburl=http://www.blah.com/viewcvs.cgi)
- whenever a log message comes in, the log handler parses the two versions changed and generates a diff link for each file changed
- whenever a log message comes in, the log handler parses the filenames and generates a link to that file's page in ViewCVS?

(summarised from Aslak's email)
> Off the top of my head: 
> 
> 1) I took this class and made it a standalone class (to make it easier 
> to test):
> http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/examples/CVSLogHandler.java
> 
> 2) I refactored handleMessage(Message) -> handleMessage(String) to make 
> it even easier to test (I didn't know how to mock back then).
> 
> 3) in the handleMessage method I added additional logic to figure out 
> the two CVS version numbers (previous and current) of the committed 
> file. (This information will be available in the Message object).
> 
> Example:
> http://www.mail-archive.com/xdoclet-devel%
> 40lists.sourceforge.net/msg12098.html
> 
> 4) I generated a String ? la:
> http://cvs.sourceforge.net/cgi-
> bin/viewcvs.cgi/xdoclet/xdoclet2/src/java/xdoclet/sdk/xgg/binding/Binder
> .java.diff?r1=1.2&r2=1.3
> 
> This requires that the base URL of ViewCVS is known. TortoiseCVS has 
> some built-in logic to guess that URL - JIRA could do the same. -And 
> fall back on an explicitly specified URL if it can't find it.
> 
> 5) Paste the generated link into the issue comment.
> 
> This means that when you commit a file and specify a JIRA issue number, 
> that issue will get a comment with a web link to the diff for that 
> commit. -In other words, a very nice way to see the actual bug fix (or 
> new feature). -And that's the only way CVS linking is *really* useful 
> IMHO.
> 
> Cheers,
> Aslak
fields.summary: CVSLogHandler ViewCVS integration

fields.description:
One of the issues (XDT-138) in the xdoclet JIRA has an attachment "actions.dtd" with type text/xml.  Trying to view or download this file just gives an error

Fatal error in file:/opt/j2ee/atlassian/jira/jira-xdoclet/xdoclet-jira-web/secure/attachment at line 2: Document root element is missing.

I was under the impression it was going to be possible to edit the file types ourselves in the newer version, but I don't see any way to do this.  Or is that an enhancement for an even newer version than we're using?

http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/xdoclet/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=XDT-138

fields.description:
There are occasions when an administrator must delete a user (e.g. in cases of user duplication) - but this is not possible if the user has reported issues.

We need the ability for an administrator to manually modify the reporter of an issue (as well as comment, etc)

-Nick
fields.summary: Require Administrative capability to change Issue Reporter

fields.description:
In the current version of Jira, the username that is used for "Reporter" is the currently logged in user.

However, some users of Jira are "helpdesk" people who are creating new issues on behalf of other people (who themselves are jira users).

It is necessary to be able to (optionally) select "Reporter" from a list.

There should also be a corresponding permission for "impersonation".

This is necessary for us to use Jira instead of Remedy.

-Nick
fields.summary: Ability to Create New Issue - but Reported by another user

fields.description: When reviewing defect entries using list or filtered list attempt to use browser back button is unsuccessful/unreliable, when wanting to return to the list. Would be great to have a fast one-button click to return to previous page, rather than navigating to a list view saving the URL to a browser link or favorite page. Then user has to click to get the link. One button method of navigation would be far superior from the user perspective.

fields.description:

From the Browse Project Change Log, the scope line is in small text and just contains links.

These two lines should be match visually.  Just a nitpick!  :)

Add 'all commenters' notification group

fields.description:
Since jira uses just one workflow file, it should be a fairly easy process to limit the destruction of the os_wfentry table. What should be done is:

for every entry with the name 'jira' in the os_wfentry table, remove all steps matching that id, then remove the wfentry.

This ensures that old jira data is removed, while non-jira workflows aren't disrupted.
fields.summary: XML import shouldn't be so ruthless in wiping out existing workflow data

fields.description:
I have noticed that the Fix Version for issues sometimes diasappears after updating an issue. 

As far as I can tell, this happens when a version is renamed and any issue that has this version as the Fix Version is later edited, the Fix Version for the issue is cleared.
fields.summary: Fix Version disappears after updating issue

fields.description:
The following should sum it up:

com.opensymphony.module.propertyset.PropertyImplementationException: Unable to esablish a connection with the database. (SAP DBTech JDBC: Cannot connect to jdbc:sapdb://localhost/jira-ofbiz [Restart required].)

If you add a database connection string but the database has not been created yet then you cannot run the wizard to create it. If the schema script is not included then you cannot create the db prior to connecting the with the wizard.

EntityEngine.Xml was modified using the following prior to ant build:

Default commented out and this was added per your docs:

<transaction-factory       class="org.ofbiz.core.entity.transaction.TyrexFactory" />

Datasource added and default commented out: (user & pass removed here)

    <datasource name="defaultDS" 
	          field-type-name="sapdb"
                helper-class="org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO" 
	          check-on-start="true" use-foreign-keys="true"
                use-foreign-key-indices="true" check-fks-on-start="true" 
                check-fk-indices-on-start="true" add-missing-on-start="true">
        <inline-jdbc jdbc-driver="com.sap.dbtech.jdbc.DriverSapDB" 
			   jdbc-uri="jdbc:sapdb://localhost/jira-ofbiz"
                     jdbc-username="****" jdbc-password="****" 
                     isolation-level="Serializable"/>
    </datasource>
fields.summary: No DB = No Wizard

fields.description:
We'd like the ability to turn off assignment on issue create, even for users who _can_ assign issues.  (Perhaps a flag?)

We currently have a small users/qa group that are the only users in our system that do not have the Assign priviledge.  The reason for this is we've found in the past they had a tendency to assign a new feature or change request straight to a developer, never telling the project manager/lead developer, and that caused some obvious problems. (Whether or not it was on the phone, "Hey can you fix this for me real quick?" or via e-mail, some our developers ended up having lots of time management issues.)

However, later in an issue's lifespan there are times when these same users (the ones who should not assign) will need to pass an issue off, or potetntially even work on an issue themselves.  So we would like to give them the assign permission.  (They have asked for it numerous times.)

So a simple solution would to have an extra config parameter that forces all new issues to be assigned to the Project Lead, regardless of the assignable permission.  If this flag were off, the assign on issue create would work just like it does now.
fields.summary: Disallow assignment on issue create, but allow reassignment later

fields.description: We may need to update the config file format for 4.1.24, but apart from that, it all *should* work.
fields.summary: Test JIRA on Tomcat 4.1.24

fields.description:
The below error occurs randomly on the console when searching for issues.  We need to replicate it, and catch it further up the chain to prevent this meaningless error.

******************************
2003-03-14 15:03:21,158 INFO [search.parameters.lucene.ResolutionParameter] Single Field Multi Value parameter is invalid it must have atleast on value that is not null or empty.

<null andQuery='true'/>
******************************
fields.summary: Remove lucene single value parameter warning

fields.description: JIRA #46 does not run on Orion 2.0.  This needs to be tested for the next release.
fields.summary: Test JIRA on Orion 2.0

fields.description:
There are a lot of extensions to JIRA which people want to build / integrate. JIRA needs a 'plugin' API to deal with these in some manner.

This plugin API could operate in a similar manner to the IntelliJ IDE Open API. Basically a plugin is a series of classes and configuration files. 

We would need to move to WebWork 2 to make it easy for people to plugin packages of actions and views (Velocity loaded from the classpath) seamlessly. 

The interface would also need to be more dynamic in places, for example the Administration decorator (links on the left) should be loaded from a file, and a plugin could specify additional links. The view issue tabs etc could be loaded by a similar method, and operations in various places.
fields.summary: Investigate possible 'plugin' ideas

fields.description: Look into replacing our home grown caching stuff with JCS from Jakarta.
fields.summary: Investigate JCS for caching

fields.description: It would be incredibly nice if the road map/change log of a project could be exported as text, csv and/or xml. A print version would be useful, too.
fields.summary: Export of road map as text file

fields.description:
We can reduce the size of a lot of the pages (as the expense of server time) by using a Gzip filter.

Average reduction in HTML should be from 40k to 5k.
fields.summary: Use Gzip filter to compress HTML from JIRA

fields.description:
When you delete a project that has issues that have attachments an ISSUE_UPDATED event is dispatched by the AttachmentDelete object even though for DeleteProject the dispatch event is set to false.

The cause of this is that Attachment Delete uses a new GenericDispatcher which defaults to true.

When the mail queue tries to send the notification it tries to get the project for the issue but of course the project has been deleted.

GetSinkFromSource then throughs an IllegalArgumentException because the project is null
fields.summary: When deleteing projects that have issues that have attachments you get Illegal Argument exception

fields.description:
We have roughly 100+ projects, 5 or so top level and the rest nested. In a tree format, as they are in our tracker, they are more managable but in a flat format this would be a scrolling nightmare.

Does the latest version support nested projects...for example:
  Hardware
     Modems
       PCI
       ISA
     CDROMS
       IDE
       SCSI

etc., etc.
fields.summary: Project List Structure

fields.description:
I have installed the build #46 which is the same as the one on your website. In Find issue section I only get 4 columns returned

T  Key  Summary  Pr  Status  
  CATGEN-1 Implement the CITG activity    Assigned  
  CATXS-1 Implement the CITG activity    Unassigned  
  CATGCL-1 Implement the CITG activity    Assigned  
  CATDI-1 fgfg    Assigned  
 
On your site (same build) there are 10 fileds returned? 
T  Key  Summary  Assignee  Reporter  Pr  Status  Res  Create  Update  
  JRA-1341 browse project permission Scott Farquhar g u    Closed  Duplicate  19/Feb/03 19/Feb/03 
  JRA-1243 export to excel doesnt load excel? Scott Farquhar g u    Closed  Fixed  05/Feb/03 03/Mar/03 
  JRA-1290 customisable report output Unassigned g u    Unassigned  UNRESOLVED  12/Feb/03 12/Feb/03 
  JRA-1289 select multiple projects to report on Unassigned g u    Unassigned  UNRESOLVED  12/Feb/03 16/Mar/03 
 
 
Is this a configuration issue or a bug??

thx,
geoff
fields.summary: output columns of report different on Jira site to released build

fields.description: Need to set the content type correctly for the XML and Excel feeds
fields.summary: Non-ascii characters don't work in XML & Excel views

fields.description: When an issue is linked to another and marked to be fixed by another issue, the dependent issue should be resolved when the issue it is dependent upon is resolved as fixed and closed. Currently links have no knowledge of their ends, which seems counterintuitive (at least in this case)
fields.summary: Cascade update statuses to dependent issues

fields.description: After deleting a subscription (it worked this time?) I get a page showing "View Subscriptions for """ with no filter selected. I think we just forgot the id parameter from the redirect page.
fields.summary: Wrong page redirected after deleting subscription

fields.description: We do not want our customers to have access to the complete bug list, but it would be good if they could monitor their own issues and for us to have access to the whole bug list from offsite.
fields.summary: New access level: view only issues reported by oneself

fields.description:
This occurs often when I:

- click a URL in notification email to view issue
- the change history tab is displayed for some reason
- I click on comments tab link then I get this:

Error 
The issue key or ID that you entered does not exist in the system. 

Please check the key or ID you entered. 
 
This is usually what is in the edit box:

GHA-13;jsessionid=C7B340CA8F9B01105F0FBAB52EF00BEE

I think maybe you can just have it remove everything after and including ;, no?
fields.summary: issue key / ID does not exist because jsession ID appears in it

fields.description: Not all groups, as listed in the Group Browser, are avialable to select in the drop down list when sharing current filter with a group.
fields.summary: Share Current Filter - Select Group, all groups not available

fields.description:
even as a Jira developer I can?t delete an associated attachement. Can?t find any permission which could fit that functionalality.

Cheers

Wolfgang Tank

Allow issue to be in different fix status for different versions

fields.description: When creating a filter, allow the user to be able to save a preferred sort sequence. For example, I always sort by Priority, and everytime I open one of my filters, I have to sort by sequence, rather than have the results screen return the result in my preferred sor sequence.
fields.summary: Save Sorting on new Filter creation

Bring up Edit Permission Scheme. Hit submit without changing anything. Notice that the name field is flagged: "A Permission Scheme with this name already exists."

But that scheme is this scheme....
fields.summary: EditPermissionScheme  Name uniqueness test doesn't ignore self

fields.summary: Exception with 2 character attachment name

fields.description: Timestamps next to attachments would be useful to differentiate between files attached of the same name. Such as a new revision of a source code file that was attached.
fields.summary: Timestamps next time attachments

fields.description: The non-commercial license is insufficient. By releasing it under GPL (GNU Public License) or something similar you will increase your user base. Also, I could use it for more than 30 days. You can model your company after Sendmail, MySQL or Redhat. Open Sourcing it will not cut into your profits, if anything it may increase them because more people will be using it.
fields.summary: Re-release as GPL
improve interface colours

fields.description: obviously the tempMax variable is set to constant value when calling the issueNaviagtor.jspa
fields.summary: full content view and XML view constantly restricted to 20 resp. 25 issues

fields.description:
We have around ten projects in Jira now (it's taking off!) so it's very important that the separate groups can update their dashboard to show only the project(s) they are interested in.  What we're getting is that the Singel Project portlet's drop-down list contains all the wrong projects, so many users cannot select the project they want.

The permissioning is on a project by project basis, so for projects a, b and c we have groups of a-users, a-developers, b-users, b-developers, c-users, c-developers.  Project a is browseable by a-users and a-developers and so on.  However, when an a-user wants to configure his dashboard, he erroneously sees projects b and c in the single project portlet.

Other than that the new dashboard is very cool indeed.
fields.summary: On selecting single project on dashboard, wrong projects displayed

fields.description:
It would save us a lot of time if we could both assign and set the 'fix for'-version in one screen. This would also(hopefully) eliminate duplicate 'update' notifications.

In our group this would be quite useful, as we use 'unassigned' as an inbox of all the issues and PM's have to sort out a whole bunch at the end of the week.
fields.summary: Combined 'Assign' and 'Set Fix for Version' Issue Function

fields.description: It would be really helpful if you could create a new task that by default inherits the base information of another task and is linked to that original task. An example of this is you find a issue which exists in multiple projects. The issue needs to be checked / verified in all the projects separately. If the person who entered the issue could create a branhc or linked copy of the issue in the other projects, then each cound be verified indilidually, and the link would still give the staff a heads up to the issue being interrelated to a issue in the other project.
fields.summary: Quick Issue Creation via Cloning

fields.description: It would be helpful to include breadcrumbs that indicated where a user was in the site and allow them to click on a parent page for quick navigation Ex:Home | Project Overview | Road Map | Issue TEST-1. the user can then click 'Road Map' to quickly jump to the list.
fields.summary: Breadcrumbs

fields.description: It would be useful to be able to add a est ETA date for a new version. It would make the road map more useful.
fields.summary: Version Date tag

fields.description: It would be useful to have the ability to create custom select fiuelds that support multi-selection. An example of this is I ave a user type field which indicates what 'type' of user in the app encounters this issue. Often its multiple. This behavior is like what you already do for component
fields.summary: Multi-select custom issue fields

fields.description:
I created a filter, and saved it, and shared it to all.
Bu the drop down in the profile, dashboard, add saved filter results page at the URL above, only lists "current open issues", which isn't a filter in our system, shared or not, as far as I know, and it certainly isn't one of mine.
fields.summary: Saved filter results portlet does not list saved (shared ?) filters

fields.description:
I have a strange problem.  When I click on the Administrators link right at the bottom of the page, I do get the list of administrators, but is completely undecorated.  It sits in the top left of screen with no stylesheet.  It's useable but looks weird.

Anyone else got this on standalone?
fields.summary: Administrators page is undecorated

fields.description:
It appears that if I have multiple types of people, or groups in the notification scheme, and I happen to be in more than one of them -- and this can happen for good reason -- that I can get two, three, or more identical emails for the same thing.

This of course is kind of silly and shouldn't happen. I can't guarantee that it's happening without me playing more ... but the scheme is annoying to work with, and now that I have it setup, that's what it appears to be doing since I have 3 identical emails for an update on a task... and I can see how I could be the Assignee, a watcher, and the Project Lead on the same issue.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Don't send Duplicate Notifications to the same email

fields.description: If you have a notification scheme that only sends users notifications on the resolved event, and not the closed event, then if you resolve and close an issue in one action, the users never receive a notification.
fields.summary: Resolved notification is not sent if issue is closed at same time

fields.description: It should be possible to edit a comment (instead of just adding a new comment).
fields.summary: Add ability to edit comments.

fields.description: When reporting a new issue the drop down list shows all projects even those my user doesn't have access to.
fields.summary: When creating a new issue the drop down shows projects that I do not have access to!

fields.description:
Invalid URL like "http://<hostname>/<dir>/" (that is h t t p : / / < h o s t n a m e > / < d i r> if you remove the spaces) are displayed incorrectly as can be seen above. Text up to '<' is marked as an URL link and '<' is displayed as & l t ; (delete spaces) entity. 

Invalid URL is displayed correctly in edit description screen and in e-mail notifications.

Was this also fixed along with JRA-1115?
fields.summary: invalid URLs in description/comments are handled incorrectly

fields.description: Store the details of the last issue created in the users session, and then a javascript button to prefill the form details on the create issue form.  This relates to a similar issue already raised.
fields.summary: Prefill Create Issue details with the details of the last issue entered

fields.description: See JRA-1464 for an environment field that wraps, but isn't escaped properly.
fields.summary: Environment field not html escaped properly

fields.description: When linking issues its would be very helpful to have a search button vs. having to enter in an issue number. You could link the search button to the existing FIND ISSUE link witha  SELECT option.
fields.summary: Linking Issues....
